content:
Since git 2.28, git introduces init.defaultBranch to specify the new repo default branch name.
Does libgit2 (which cargo uses) support this?
I built and checked cargo on master commit, seems like cargo doesn't support this yet.

I believe it depends what you mean by support. But there have been issues working on it recently. for example
https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/8522

When using cargo new, a new git repo is created. It seems that cargo doesn't yet respect the init.defaultBranch git config used to determine the name of the default branch when creating a new git repo.
yeah, that's it. My English is not good really.
I feel like I have seen a bug report about that. There is a flag that teles cargo to use cli git instead of libgit2, if it works with that flag then we are just waiting on libgit2 support.
@Eh2406 Yeah, I think someone just needs to implement it in libgit2.
There is already a PR open for that.
